intro: Grias haughtii, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a slightly waxy surface. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Grias haughtii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a container plant.
